item.title: Dark Auction music team adds Tsukasa Masuko; ‘Special Trailer’
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Switch

New story scenes, exploration segments, and more showcased.

Tsukasa Masuko, known for his work on the Megami Tensei series, has joined the music production team for mystery adventure game Dark Auction, publisher Good Smile Company, and publisher and developer IzanagiGames announced. Masuko joins the team led by Yuko Komiyama from the Monster Hunter series, as well as the previously announced jazz band.

Here are the latest details:

Special Trailer

A special trailer packed with the key highlights of the game is now available.

It features newly revealed story scenes, free-exploration segments where players can move and investigate at their own pace, and the pivotal auction sequences that shape the course of the narrative.

The footage offers a deep look into the core gameplay experience and the world of Dark Auction.

We invite you to watch the trailer and immerse yourself even further in the atmosphere of the game.

Tsukasa Masuko

Career:

  • November 1982 – Joined Teacan Co., Ltd., Development Department as a part-time employee.
  • April 1984 – Full-time employee, Teacan Co., Ltd., Development Department.
  • April 1986 – Joined Atlus Co., Ltd. as a founding member.
  • April 1989 – Began working as a freelance composer.

Notable Works:

  • Star Force, Bonjacks, Megami Tensei series, Magical Vacation, Super Smash Bros. Brawl, Caligula, and others

Yuko Komiyama

Composer and arranger.

Joined Capcom, where she contributed to music composition and supervision for titles such as the Monster Hunter series and the Mega Man X series.

Became a freelance composer in 2012.

Notable Works:

  • Game: Monster Hunter: World / Iceborne (composition), Kingdom Hearts III (arrangements), Final Fantasy Pixel Remaster (arrangements)
  • Anime & Commercials: Provided music for Maru Janai Shima no Shikaku na Pokémon!? and others

Steam Free Demo Now Available

A free demo of Dark Auction is now available on Steam!

Don’t forget to add the game to your wishlist!

About Dark Auction

A new, fully-fledged mystery adventure game, featuring original story and scenario by Rika Suzuki (Another Code, Hotel Dusk: Room 215), with character designs by Kohske, the author of the manga GANGSTA.. Music is composed by Yuko Komiyama (Monster Hunter series) and Tsukasa Masuko (Megami Tensei series).

The game is scheduled for release on January 29, 2026, for Nintendo Switch, Steam, and PlayStation 5.

Story

1981, Somewhere in Europe.

Eighteen-year-old Noah is haunted by the memory of his mother abandoning him at a very young age. He lives with his father Leonardo, a failed writer and eccentric obsessed with researching “Dictator X.” Though Noah wishes he would stop, Leonardo refuses to give up this strange pursuit, even as they struggle financially.

One day, an invitation arrives for an auction selling items connected to “Dictator X.” Ignoring Noah’s protests, Leonardo sets off for the ancient castle where the auction is to be held, promising to tell Noah everything once he returns.

But Leonardo never comes home. With no way to contact him, Noah heads to the castle himself—only to witness something shocking. Now trapped inside with the other guests, Noah is invited by the mysterious auctioneer to take part in the event himself.

Characters

  • Noah Crawford (voiced by Kengo Kawanishi)
  • Leonard Crawford (voiced by Rikiya Koyama)
  • Edgar Schulz (voiced by Daisuke Namikawa)
  • Christoph Treheim von Berg (voiced by Nobunaga Shimazaki)
  • Otto Klein (voiced by Shunsuke Takeuchi)
  • Karla Becker (voiced by Maaya Uchida)
  • Lorraine Klopp (voiced by Yui Ishikawa)
  • Hell (voiced by Akira Ishida)
  • Auctioneer (voiced by Show Hayami)

Dark Auction is due out for PlayStation 5, Switch, and PC via Steam on January 29, 2026.

Watch the new trailer below.

item.title: Lollipop Chainsaw RePOP update to add first Costume Design Contest winner in mid-December
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox One
  • Xbox Series

First look at the "Cutie Zombie Hunter" outfit.

Dragami Games will release the fan-made “Cutie Zombie Hunter” costume for Lollipop Chainsaw RePOP as a free update in mid-December, the company announced. The costume, which won the Lollipop Chainsaw RePOP Costume Design Contest’s “Best Costume Award,” will be followed by additional winning designs from the contest.

Here are the latest details:

Winning Costume Design from the Contest Will Soon Be Implemented!

From September 2 to October 27, 2025, we held the Lollipop Chainsaw RePOP Costume Design Contest. Today, we are excited to reveal the design selected by fans as the Best Costume Award: the “Cutie Zombie Hunter” costume.

—Design Illustration

—3D Model

This design will be added to the game through a free update scheduled for mid-December. With the holiday season approaching, we hope you enjoy this special present from Dragami Games!

Additional winning designs from the Costume Design Contest will continue to be implemented in future updates. You can view all winning entries here.

Get Lollipop Chainsaw RePOP at a Special Price During the Year-End & New Year Discount Campaign!

A discount campaign for Lollipop Chainsaw RePOP is scheduled for December! It’s the perfect opportunity to enjoy the game with its newly added costumes—don’t miss it!

Please note that start and end dates vary by platform, so be sure to check the schedule below.

In addition to Lollipop Chainsaw RePOP, other Dragami Games titles will also be included in the discount campaign. For example, on the Nintendo eShop, the Nintendo Switch 2 exclusive title released in September—Relayer Advanced Definitive Edition—will be available at 30 percent-off. Make sure to check it out as well!

item.title: Retro-style first-person fantasy action RPG Queen’s Domain announced for PC
item.content:encoded:
• PC

Embark on a quest to find your father who disappeared.

Publisher Future Friends Game and developer Freshly Baked Games has announced retro-style first-person fantasy action RPG Queen’s Domain for PC (Steam). A release date was not announced. A demo is available now.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

Queen’s Domain is a retro-fantasy action RPG. Washed up on the shores of the Isle of Neasied, you set out to find your father and uncover the dark heart of this mysterious isle.

Wield the Legendary Holy Sword Endu to take flight from platform to platform, and discover an interconnected, labyrinthine world where secrets and dangers lurk around every corner.

Fight action-oriented battles with a classic stamina meter, powerful charge attacks, weapon specific special attacks, and secondary throwing weapons. Level up, accessorize, and choose from a huge catalogue of melee weapons on your quest to fight your way through the hordes of monsters and powerful bosses awaiting you in the darkest depths of the isle.

Key Features

  • Explore an interconnected island filled with hidden secrets.
  • Lovingly crafted retro-fantasy aesthetic.
  • Action-combat with a stamina meter, special attacks, throwing weapons and more.
  • Fly across gaps with your Holy Sword—use upgrades to fly further!
  • Dozens of hours of adventuring and exploration.
  • Over 50 melee weapons to discover, equip, and upgrade.
  • Use XP to level up, and eat delicious food to further increase your stats.
  • Over 20 types of secondary throwing weapons allow for varied strategies in combat.
  • Over 100 enemies, mini bosses, and bosses to defeat.

Watch the announcement trailer below.

item.title: ROMEO IS A DEAD MAN launches February 11, 2026
item.content:encoded:
“Ultra-violent science-fiction” action game ROMEO IS A DEAD MAN will launch for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC via Steam and Microsoft Store on February 11, 2026 for $49.99, developer Grasshopper Manufacture announced. It will be self-published by Grasshopper Manufacture.

Here is an overview of the game, via Grasshopper Manufacture:

About

Take control of the protagonist Romeo Stargazer in this third person single-player action adventure, split into various chapters. His story is both unpredictable and littered with intense battles, interspersed with side missions to suit the player’s pace.

Fight Blood With Blood

Romeo switches between swords and guns to fight. Wipe out the waves of enemies that stand in your path to give birth to a new kind of bloody action, and take down the fearsome space-time criminals that await. Absorb the blood of your enemies to unleash Romeo’s special attack: Bloody Summer, capable of turning any situation around. Romeo’s various weapons can be strengthened and altered as the story moves forward as he takes on even stronger enemies.

A Story That Transcends Space-Time

This game’s story starts with space-time itself being shattered by a certain incident. Romeo, too, on the brink of life and death finds himself revived by a new kind of super technology. Thus he is recruited for the FBI’s Space-Time Police as a special agent, and wanders the cosmos in search of criminals who’ve taken advantage of the situation at hand in an attempt to bring justice back to the universe. At the same time, he looks for clues concerning his missing girlfriend Juliet, and quickly comes to find both her disappearance and the destruction of space may be more linked than he thought. Donning the mask called Deadgear, what awaits Romeo at the edges of space-time?

Watch a new trailer and today’s “Grasshopper Direct: 5 Minutes feat. ROMEO IS A DEAD MAN” below. View a new set of screenshots at the gallery.
